alert.note: Alert for Broward; Palm Beach (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 06 at 3:34PM EDT until June 06 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Palm Beach. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 333 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain have ended over the advisory area. However, 1 to 2 inches of rainfall has occurred over the area from the earlier heavy rains. This amount on rainfall will take some time to drain away. Therefore, the Flood Advisory will remain in effect until 5 PM EDT this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pompano Beach, Boca Raton, Deerfield Beach, Margate, Lighthouse Point, Coconut Creek, Hillsboro Beach, Boca Del Mar, Boca Pointe, Hamptons At Boca Raton, Hillsboro Ranches, Fau South Campus, Sandalfoot Cove, Boca West and Hillsboro Pines. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely.
